metadata.title: veterinary microbiology Short Communication Studies on the survival of canine coronavirus under different environmental conditions

abstract.original_text: Canine coronavirus (CCV) is a common faecal agent which is difficult to isolate. This study shows CCV to survive well at temperatures below -20°C but not at temperatures above 4°(:. The presence of faecal material markedly reduced CCV survival times at temperatures ranging from 20°C to -70°C. Thus, it is suggested that diagnostic faecal material should be diluted 1:10 (w/v) with growth medium and examined at the earliest opportunity.

sentences.segment_text: Canine coronavirus ( CCV ) is a common faecal agent which is difficult to isolate .
This study shows CCV to survive well at temperatures below -20 °C but not at temperatures above 4 ° ( : .
The presence of faecal material markedly reduced CCV survival times at temperatures ranging from 20 °C to -70 °C .
Thus , it is suggested that diagnostic faecal material should be diluted 1:10 ( w/v ) with growth medium and examined at the earliest opportunity .
